page.title: 07SITTINGBOURNE ANGLING CLUB
page.content: The Sittingbourne Angling Club was founded in 1954. There were originally just 25 members; now the membership has to be limited to 500 which includes 100 juniors. They fish at the three lakes at Murston which were formerly clay-pits from the old brickworks. The lakes, known as Broombank, are leased to the Club by F.T.Holt (Farms) Ltd. The season starts on June 16th and runs through until March 14th. The lakes have a wide variety of freshwater fish including carp, tench, bream and pike. The Club holds several internal competitions each year and sends teams to matches with other clubs. The Club also has a busy social programme for its membership.
